definition: to draw back the corners of one's mouth

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: His smile spread out to his cars again, and he headed for the checkouts .
sentences.chinese: 他又咧开嘴笑了，赶快奔向收款台。

sentences.english: Miles grinned and shook his head while clicking his tongue against his teeth.
sentences.chinese: 迈尔斯摇着头咧开嘴笑了，用舌头敲着牙齿。

sentences.english: Professor Mortimer leaned back and grinned.
sentences.chinese: 莫蒂默教授身子向后靠并咧开嘴笑。

sentences.english: Tom went blank and then grinned.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆愣了一下，然后咧开嘴笑了。

sentences.english: My husband voiced no objection, and Owens and Bronwen smiled broadly.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫没有表示反对，欧文斯与布朗文咧开嘴笑了。

sentences.english: You need to consult a meditation book.
sentences.chinese: 校长咧开嘴笑着说，“你需要查阅一下冥想方面的书。

sentences.english: Turned, you excited to close my eyes, couldn't help grinning.
sentences.chinese: 转过身之后，你兴奋地闭上双眼，忍不住咧开嘴笑。

sentences.english: The wide grin showed all his ivories.
sentences.chinese: 他咧开嘴笑，露出了全部牙齿。

sentences.english: They grinned with pleasure when I gave them the sweets.
sentences.chinese: 当我给他们糖果时，他们乐意地咧开嘴笑了。

sentences.english: His brother broke into a pleased smile .
sentences.chinese: 弟弟高兴地咧开嘴笑了。

definition: brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
to giggle/to laugh foolishly/to smirk/to simper
to put on a fake smile (idiom)/to smile insincerely
to narrow one's eyes/to squint/(dialect) to take a nap
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
